## Slide with Plot and Padding

## Kaiser Health Insurance Quiz

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
<iframe src="https://embed.polleverywhere.com/multiple_choice_polls/kuRD4KEhXSwiOAWgFBS9J?controls=none&amp;short_poll=true" width="800px" height="600px">

</iframe>
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: {style="padding-top: 150px;"}
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| fig-width: 3
#| fig-height: 4


library(tidyverse)
kff_res <- 
  tibble(score = 0:10, pct = c(8,5,5,4,6,10,10,18,18,12,4))
pollev_color = "#6193c5"
  
kff_res %>% 
  mutate(score = glue::glue("{score} out of 10")) %>% 
  mutate(score = factor(score, levels =rev(c(
    "0 out of 10","1 out of 10","2 out of 10","3 out of 10","4 out of 10", "5 out of 10",
    "6 out of 10","7 out of 10","8 out of 10","9 out of 10","10 out of 10"
  )))) %>% 
  mutate(colr = pollev_color) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(y = score, x = pct, fill = colr)) + 
  geom_col() + 
  geom_text(hjust=1.2,colour = "white",aes(label = glue::glue("{pct}%"))) + 
  ggthemes::theme_tufte() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = "#6193c5") + 
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  labs(y="",x="Percent")+
  theme(text=element_text(family="Arial", face="bold", size=12)) +
  ggtitle("How Others Scored")

 

```
:::

| [Cost-effectiveness analysis]{style="color: grey;"} | [Monetary units]{style="color: grey;"}          | [Single effect of interest, common to both alternatives, but achieved to different degrees.]{style="color: grey;"} | [Natural units (e.g., life-years gained, disability days saved, points of blood pressure reduction, etc.)]{style="color: grey;"} |
| [Cost-utility analysis]{style="color: grey;"}       | [Monetary units]{style="color: grey;"}          | [Single or multiple effects, not necessarily common to both alternatives.]{style="color: grey;"}                   | [Healthy years (typically measured as quality-adjusted life-years)]{style="color: grey;"}                                        |
